page.title: 16AN EVENING ACTIVITY.
page.content: It is very tiring getting home from school,doing my homework, having my tea and going to Cadets, but I enjoy it. Before leaving I polish my boots, put on my uniform and pack my knife and gaters. At around 6.10p.m. I leave home and cycle the three miles to the local Sea Cadets, and usually meet my friends there. The night seems to go very quickly as we march and drill, learn about different aspects of sailing and life in the Royal Navy. We usually have a break in the middle of each session and I normally take some money with me to buy a drink and some sweets. Once inside the Cadets Centre we use all the same terms as the Navy and, although we sometimes forget, it makes the evening very different. { {
